27#include "includes.h"
28__RCSID("$NetBSD: uuencode.c,v 1.10 2017/04/18 18:41:46 christos Exp $");
29#include <sys/types.h>
30#include <netinet/in.h>
31#include <resolv.h>
32#include <stdio.h>
33#include <stdlib.h>
34
35#include "xmalloc.h"
36#include "uuencode.h"
37
38/*
39 * Encode binary 'src' of length 'srclength', writing base64-encoded text
40 * to 'target' of size 'targsize'. Will always nul-terminate 'target'.
41 * Returns the number of bytes stored in 'target' or -1 on error (inc.
42 * 'targsize' too small).
43 */
44int
45uuencode(const u_char *src, u_int srclength,
46 char *target, size_t targsize)
47{
48 return __b64_ntop(src, srclength, target, targsize);
49}
50
51/*
52 * Decode base64-encoded 'src' into buffer 'target' of 'targsize' bytes.
53 * Will skip leading and trailing whitespace. Returns the number of bytes
54 * stored in 'target' or -1 on error (inc. targsize too small).
55 */
56int
57uudecode(const char *src, u_char *target, size_t targsize)
58{
59 int len;
60 char *encoded, *p;
61
62 /* copy the 'readonly' source */
63 encoded = xstrdup(src);
64 /* skip whitespace and data */
65 for (p = encoded; *p == ' ' || *p == '\t'; p++)
66 ;
67 for (; *p != '\0' && *p != ' ' && *p != '\t'; p++)
68 ;
69 /* and remove trailing whitespace because __b64_pton needs this */
70 *p = '\0';
71 len = __b64_pton(encoded, target, targsize);
72 free(encoded);
73 return len;
74}
75
76void
77dump_base64(FILE *fp, const u_char *data, u_int len)
78{
79 char *buf;
80 int i, n;
81
82 if (len > 65536) {
83 fprintf(fp, "dump_base64: len > 65536\n");
84 return;
85 }
86 buf = xreallocarray(NULL, 2, len);
87 n = uuencode(data, len, buf, 2*len);
88 for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
89 fprintf(fp, "%c", buf[i]);
90 if (i % 70 == 69)
91 fprintf(fp, "\n");
92 }
93 if (i % 70 != 69)
94 fprintf(fp, "\n");
95 free(buf);
96}
